title: Asda’s ghost crumpets are back for your spooky Halloween breakfast
text:
From Good Housekeeping

Asda’s Ghost Crumpets are back by popular demand for Halloween this year.

Perfect for when you’re after a scary snack or for dishing-up the perfect breakfast treat for families this October.

The spooktacular toasted treat adds a little seasonal flare to your breakfast at this time of year and they’re super cheap too at six for £1.

Like their less spooky counterparts, the Ghost Crumpets are best lightly toasted until golden brown, topped with loads of melted butter and jam.

Photo credit: Asda More

BUY NOW Asda Ghost Crumpets, £1

An Asda Spokesperson said: “We know that shaped, novelty crumpets are always a popular choice amongst our customers, and we wanted to treat our customers to our delicious Ghost Crumpets once again - no trick and all treat.

“This year, Asda has introduced several novelty crumpets including Love Heart Crumpets, Bunny Crumpets and Teddy Crumpets.”

These are going straight to the top of our shopping list!

If you're looking for other Halloween-themed treats to enjoy this year, you're spoilt for choice. There's pumpkin spice-flavoured chocolate liqueur at Ocado, and everything from a meatloaf mummy to a bubbling cheese cauldron available from Marks & Spencer.

For those interested in homemade spooky treats, we have a range of ideas including spiced pumpkin doughnuts and 'Creature of the Deep' cheesecake that are suitable for chefs of all cooking abilities.

Asda’s Ghost Crumpets are available in Asda stores and online for £1 per pack now.
